ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In the average day, for the past week, how much time did you spend pulling hairs?
Notes: 0 = None; 1 = Less than or equal to 15 minutes; 2 = 16-30 minutes; 3 = 31-60 minutes; 4 = 1-2 hours; 5 = 2 or more hours

ElementDescription: Which hairs did you pull this week?
How much time did you spend pulling hairs yesterday?
Notes: 0 = None; 1 = Less than or equal to 15 minutes; 2 = 16-30 minutes; 3 = 31-60 minutes; 4 = 1-2 hours; 5 = 2 or more hours

ElementDescription: What were the thoughts or feelings preceding the pulling episode?
Did you attempt to resist the urge to pull?
Notes: 0 = No urges; 1 = Successfully resisted the urge to pull; 2 = Moderately successful in resisting the urge to pull; 3 = Limited success in resisting the urge to pull; 4 = Unsuccessful in resisting the urge to pull; 5 = No resistance

ElementDescription: How much are you bothered by this compulsion / habit?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 5 = Very, very much

ElementDescription: How much does hair pulling interfere with your daily life?
NIMH Trichotillomania Impairment Scale (NIMH-TIS) Global Scale
Notes: 0 = No impairment; 1-3 = Minimal Impairment; 4-6 = Mild Impairment; 7-10 = Moderate/Severe Impairment
